data.title: Music World Celebrates Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan's Birthday

Music World Celebrates Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan's Birthday

Report by Kamala Kanta Dash, Bhubaneswar:

Today is the Birthday of Ustad Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan. The music world is celebrating the day by remembering his soulful voice. Search engine giant Google also paid rich tributes to the master singer with a doodle. Millions of his fans are visiting YouTube today to listen to his songs and also watch his performances.

Mr. Khan is widely credited for taking the Qawwali, a devotional music of the Sufi order, to the international level and is considered as the Father of modern Qawwali. With an extraordinary ability to sing for long hours and a gifted voice with rich variety, the Ustad was born in Pakistan on 13 October 1948. He lived for 48 years and made rich contributions to Pakistani music and film industry. He also sang a few super hit songs for the Bollywood based films.

A leading World Music artist, he toured more than 40 countries to perform and left an indelible imprint on the connoisseurs of global music. He has left a rich legacy and continues to be the leading voice of Qawwali.
